runs.comm: squirted off the outside edge straight away, uppish but through the gully and well wide of any fielder
leaden-footed waft from Davies first ball, and he's beaten on the outside edge as the ball just seams away from him a touch
leading edge! Chipped over cover! Davies was trying to whip that through midwicket but the ball just stopped in the wicket to take the leading edge. Falls safely though
and now an inside edge past the stumps! It's all happening out there, and life is proving hard for batsmen on both teams!
or is it? Kieswetter runs down the wicket and thumps a full ball infront of point. That came out of the middle, and Kieswetter's on the attack
again he charges down the track, this time looking to go over midwicket. But the ball takes the inside edge of the bat and goes nowhere
Shoaib steams in, banging this one in halfway down! Kieswetter sways back and drops the hands, and Shoaib wanders down towards him for a quick word
back of a length again, nudged into the leg side
beaten on the outside edge! Good pace, bounce and carry for Shoaib, and that's 92.3mph

Shoaib strikes! Three dot balls and the pressure was getting to Kieswetter, he aimed an enormous swipe to leg but succeeded only in getting a thick edge. Kamran holds on to the chance, and Shoaib's trademark airplane celebration comes out! He blows a kiss to Kieswetter as he runs past him too!
on a length, on or around off stump. Not much in the way of movement, but good pace and nothing to be done with it
quick again, and an inside edge rockets past the stumps! Straight to short fine leg though, so no run
nudged carefully through midwicket for a couple, nothing expansive just placing the ball there
this one was slightly more of a heave from Davies, but again he places it well and picks up two more to midwicket
good batting from Davies, he backed away to leg and Razzaq followed him. But he picked up the line and length early and just lifted it over short fine leg for four
now, has he been beaten or did he leave this? Razzaq landed one on a length and Davies just left the bat hanging there as the ball burst past the outside edge
flicked through midwicket, and that'll be two more as Davies scampers back
flicked to short fine leg, and Shoaib defies the years to leap to his left and cut that off! Great fielding from the fiery fast bowler
slower ball from Shoaib,  but the line's all wrong and the ball is sprayed down the leg side

lobbed, chipped, but short of mid-on! Tennis ball bounce off the pitch to take the leading edge of Davies' bat once again, but it was such a bad connection in the shot as he tried to flick to leg that the ball didn't get very far at all
resounding crack off the bat as Bopara leans forward and defends a full, fast ball solidly into the covers

short, wide and Bopara grabs four with a flashing cut! There was plenty of pace on the ball, but it was much too wide. Bopara slashed at it with both feet in the air, and got great timing in the shot to send the ball racing away

inswinger from Shoaib, striking Bopara on the pad but going well over the stumps and the appeal is quickly quashed. Bopara thinks about a quick single but is immediately sent back - and rightly so, as the throw comes in and shatters the stumps
very, very quick from Shoaib! Back of a length outside off, but it's treated with disdain by Bopara, who walks down the pitch and swings the ball into the leg side
another hopping uppercut from Bopara as Shoaib bangs this in, but it's cut off before the rope as there was a man out on the cover boundary
Riaz finds some seam movement straight away, jagging the ball away from the left-handed Davies to beat the outside edge
ooh, but it's a filthy follow-up from Riaz. Meaty half-volley outside off and Davies isn't going to miss out on that, cracking a drive up and over cover
full, but speared at leg stump this side and clipped out to long leg, where Umar Gul fumbles to let them back for another run

could've been run out! The ball was tapped straight to Umar, a frantic single was taken as the throw was fired in, but Davies is home! Riaz was in front of the stumps, grabbing the ball and trying to flick it onto the stumps. If he had been behind the stumps and that had hit, it could've been a different story...
carefully pushed behind square on the off side
very full but wide of off, Bopara jams the bat down on the ball but can't get it away
back of a length, just outside off and quick. Davies just drops the ball into the off side and they steal a scrambled single

on a length, Bopara punches the ball back to Shoaib, who picks it up in his follow-through and threatens to throw the stumps down. And then, just for good measure, he walks down to give Bopara a good, old-fashioned fast bowler's stare
great slower ball from Shoaib! Bopara was slightly wrong-footed as the ball got to him, but managed to get bat on ball and protest his stumps
and he follows that with a quick bouncer, but Bopara is quickly into position to hook it away ... he struggles to time the shot, however, and the ball plugs as it lands in the outfield
spicy bowling from Shoaib, 95.6mph, but it's pushed slightly down the leg side. The ball comes off Davies' pad and they take a leg bye

what an effort! Two men with a combined age of 71 get together to remove Bopara! It was another quick, length delivery from Shoaib just outside off and Bopara tried to heave it to long-on. He got right underneath though, and Yousuf backpeddled as quickly as he could from mid-on, tottering slightly as he went but he managed to cling on. Smiles all round
nudged to short fine leg
Davies looks a touch suspect when he doesn't move his feet to the shorter length deliveries, as happens here. Beaten on the outside edge as he pushes at the ball from the crease
width offered outside off, and the ball is clattered out to the man on the cover boundary
tap and run from Colly, and the shy comes in from mid-off but it's wide of the stumps and he's home
speared down the leg side, the ball clips something on the way through to Kamran and there's an appeal for a catch but it's a half-hearted one. Looked to have come off the thigh pad
a touch of width outside off again, and Davies picks up one to the cover sweeper
wrong 'un to start, and Davies chops down to short third man
now that looked like an offspinner, it was full outside off and Davies drove into the off side
shocking fielding from Gul! The ball was crashed out into the off side, he sprinted after it but managed simply to escort it to the ropes and then tumble over his own feet in an effort to stop it
tapped behind square on the off side for a single
Colly nurdles through midwicket, and some good running gets him two

gone this time! Afridi really held this one back, very slow through the air and it was the legspinner. It was pitched slightly short and Collingwood was waiting to thump a pull over midwicket,  but the ball took the inside edge of his bat and cannoned into the stumps. Afridi strikes in his first over!
full outside off to start, Davies drives watchfully to mid-off, who is up
very full outside off once again, and chipped over point by Davies. Umar Akmal sprints round to cut it off and rockets in a really good throw to his brother
on a length, outside off and angling across Morgan. The batsman tries to cut it away behind square but finds Fawad Alam
nice, tight bowling from Gul as he fires this one full on off stump. Morgan defends to extra cover and "no!" is the call

Morgan walks across to the off side and flicks a low full toss towards Saeed Ajmal ... they set off for what could have been a suicidal single, but Ajmal - whose hands were "trembling" as the ball approached him according to Ramiz Raja - can't field cleanly

it doesn't matter, he's got a wicket with his next ball! Gul strikes to remove the set batsman and Davies departs. The ball was back of a length, but not all that short. Davies played a whipped-pull off his hip but hit the ball in the air and straight to Riaz
full and flat, Morgan drives to cover
great shot from Morgan! He moved across to the off side and ran the ball off the face of the bat very fine down to fine leg. Good thinking, and superb placement. A calm shot
this time he tries to slap the ball away behind square on the off side, but hits the field
chopped into the covers, and they sprint through for one
pulled down a touch short, Wright cuts but hits the point fielder

bowled! Wright shuffled across to off and tried to paddle-sweep the ball away, but it was too full for the shot, sneaking past the bat and crashing into the stumps! Afridi has another one, and Pakistan are right in this game
Eoin Morgan is the key for England, his calmness is incredible, here he eases a cover drive through point sending it racing away for four
dropped into the off side, Morgan scampers off for a single to bring Yardy on strike
good shot first up from Yardy, walking from his stance well outside leg stump into line and creaming a drive to deep point
poor delivery from Gul but Morgan can't take full toll, cutting a short and wide delivery straight to the man at deep point
good delivery this time, heading for the top of off and Yardy can do nothing but nudge it to point

neatly played from Yardy and... oh goodness, Shoaib Akhtar has made an absolute hash of a routine stop, it was flicked round the corner for what should have been a single to fine leg but Shoaib managed to fluff it entirely
nicely done from Morgan, skipping down the pitch and nudging down the ground for a single
bit of a mix up here because Morgan runs twice as fast as Yardy and called through for a second with Yardy still wheezing from the first
single taken this time with no alarms
well well well, if his fielding last over was poor this drop from Shoaib was absolutely grim. The Morgan reverse-sweep looped gently straight to Shoaib who put down the simplest chance
chopped to cover for a single
this time Yardy pokes carefully to cover for a single
top shot from Yardy first up, really excellent shot, leaning into a cover drive and sending it speeding to the boundary
dropped by Kamran, tough chance as it flicked the edge, Kamran didn't even get a hand on it, it just flicked the edge and went off his knee
this time a single taken more securely
oh lovely shot, Morgan just opens the face a fraction and allows it to run off the face for a boundary
Morgan stretches forward to dab this into the leg side for a single
Yardy pokes a top-spinner in front of square on the leg side to collect a single and finish a good over for England
sliding away, slightly quicker ball from Afridi and it beats the outside edge
this is more secure, Yardy back in his crease and pushing into the leg side for a single
tucked away wide of square leg for an ambled single
full toss from Afridi, Yardy chips it down the ground for a single, that's all England need now
this is a good ball, sliding away from the left hander and beating Morgan outside off stump
excellent work from Morgan! How expensive will that drop prove, this is cut firmly past point for another boundary, England back in charge now
full toss bunted down the ground for a couple
slightly shorter and Yardy defends from deep in his crease
oh lovely shot, Yardy is playing a blinder here, deep in his crease and deflecting the ball past the keeper and inside of third man for four
too quick from Ajmal, not finding the turn Swann did, Yardy flicks it to deep midwicket for a couple
big appeal from Ajmal, massive appeal as Yardy misses a sweep, but it struck outside the line
big appeal again but this was even more optimistic, striking the pad well outside off
good running gets Morgan a couple first up, driving off the back foot to cover and scampering a couple
this time it's a touch shorter and Morgan flicks off his hip round the corner for a single
Yardy brings up the 50 stand and what a partnership it's been, Yardy calmly drives this to deep cover for a couple, he's timed the ball really sweetly today
good delivery, tucking Yardy up and he pushes it to midwicket
sharp bouncer that Yardy actually plays too early on, jumping back and flashing  on to a pull shot before the ball had arrived
great timing from Yardy once more and he's picked out the right fielder too, Yousuf wheezing alongside the ball, escorting it to the deep midwicket boundary to end Shoaib's spell
Morgan down very early to sweep and dabs it neatly behind him for a couple
big open space at cow corner and Morgan finds the gap with an ugly-looking pull, mighty effective though
Morgan gives himself room and cuts a single to deep point
how about this, Yardy leaves alone outside off stump. England pretty much there now, this partnership has made it into a doddle
fetches a sweep from way outside off  towards deep backward square leg, excellent running once again
carefully driven to mid off, so Morgan will get a chance to hit the winnings runs

Morgan's done it, wow, this partnership has won England the game in a flash, short ball from Gul that Morgan crashes through point to the boundary to seal the result. He runs down and gives Yardy a big hug and the World Twenty20 champions won this at a canter in the end
